column5: Early June, Rainy Lake. Any thoughts on downrigging for walleye's. Unnessessary? Problematic with obsticals? Highly Productive in the North Arm?

I don't think you will need downriggers in June. I fish 4 1/2 hours north of Rainy for walleyes and we catch them in the curren or on the flats at that time of year. Anywhere from 3-15 feet deep. Riggers maybe during summer peak. Mainly for eyes out in open water.
